intro: Eschscholzia crocea, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and yellow center, with narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, often found in dry, open habitats. The California poppy is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
